intro: Echium carriezii, commonly known as the Canary Islands fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves are adapted to the arid climate of its native environment. Echium carriezii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and showy blooms.
